heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 21 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.8°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 624 m) and light levels (up 4054 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 9500 lux) and cloud levels (up 1136 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 623.5m lower than yesterday, 1136.0m lower than the past week, 776.0m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 929m to 2240m and averaged 921.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and calm and still conditions are expected. Drizzle or light rain possible, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and dim or diffuse light conditions. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (93%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
